intro: Ecbolium spergulifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three narrow, lance-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Ecbolium spergulifolium is adapted to thrive in temperate climates and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with soil bacteria.
